tramp.英释: If you tramp somewhere, you walk there slowly and with regular, heavy steps, for a long time

rally.中释: 重整旗鼓, 给予新力量, (使)恢复健康, 力量, 决心, 集结
rally.英释: to become stronger again after a period of weakness or defeat

avert.英释: to look away from something so that you do not see it

vaunt.英释: to describe, praise, or display (one's success, possessions, etc) boastfully

deter.英释: to stop someone from doing something, by making them realize it will be difficult or have bad results

emote.中释: <美口>夸张地作为, 表现感情
emote.英释: to clearly show emotion, especially when you are acting

cater.中释: 备办食物, 满足(需要), 投合

plead.英释: to ask for something that you want very much, in a sincere and emotional way

welsh.中释: 不付赌金而溜掉, 逃避履行义务, 食言
welsh.英释: If someone welshes on a deal or an agreement, they do not do the things they promised to do as part of that deal or agreement

snarl.中释: 缠结, 混乱, 吠, 咆哮, 怒骂
snarl.英释: if an animal snarls, it makes a low angry sound and shows its teeth

ensue.英释: to happen after or as a result of something

kneel.英释: to be in or move into a position where your body is resting on your knees

yearn.中释: 渴望, 想念, 怀念, 向往
yearn.英释: to have a strong desire for something, especially something that is difficult or impossible to get

drool.英释: to let  saliva (= the liquid in your mouth )  come out of your mouth

deign.英释: to do something that you think you are really too important to do – often used humorously

elope.中释: 私奔, 潜逃, 出走
elope.英释: to leave your home secretly in order to get married

snoop.中释: 探听, 调查, 偷窃
snoop.英释: If someone snoops around a place, they secretly look around it in order to find out things

shirk.英释: to deliberately avoid doing something you should do, because you are lazy

demur.中释: 提出异议, 反对, 抗辩, 犹豫
demur.英释: to express doubt about or opposition to a plan or suggestion

cavil.英释: to make unnecessary complaints about someone or something

reign.中释: 统治, 支配, 盛行, 占优势
reign.英释: if a feeling or quality reigns, it exists strongly for a period of time

cower.英释: to bend low and move back because you are frightened

preen.中释: (鸟)用嘴整理, 打扮, 赞扬
preen.英释: if a bird preens or preens itself, it cleans itself and makes its feathers smooth using its beak

twirl.英释: If you twirl something or if it twirls, it turns around and around with a smooth, fast movement

beget.中释: (书面语) 招致, 产生, 引起
beget.英释: to cause something or make it happen

strip.英释: to remove something that is covering the surface of something else

adopt.英释: to take someone else’s child into your home and legally become its parent

douse.中释: 插入水中, 把弄熄, 弄湿, 放松
douse.英释: to plunge or be plunged into water or some other liquid; duck

scour.中释: 冲洗, 擦亮, (搜索或追捕时)急速走遍
scour.英释: to clean something very thoroughly by rubbing it with a rough material

endue.中释: 穿上, 授予, 赋予
endue.英释: to invest or provide, as with some quality or trait

prick.中释: 刺, 戳, 刺痛, 竖起
prick.英释: to make a small hole in something using something sharp

baste.中释: 粗缝, 润以油脂, (在烤肉上)涂油, 狠揍, 大骂
baste.英释: to pour liquid or melted fat over food that is cooking

deice.中释: 防止结冰, 装以除冰装置, 除冰

evoke.中释: 唤起, 引起, 博得
evoke.英释: to produce a strong feeling or memory in someone

repel.中释: 击退, 抵制, 使厌恶, 使不愉快
repel.英释: if something repels you, it is so unpleasant that you do not want to be near it, or it makes you feel ill

feign.中释: 假装, 装作, 捏造, <古>想象
feign.英释: to pretend to have a particular feeling or to be ill, asleep etc

parse.英释: to describe the grammar of a word when it is in a particular sentence, or the grammar of the whole sentence

exert.中释: 尽(力), 施加(压力等), 努力
exert.英释: to work very hard and use a lot of physical or mental energy

remit.中释: 宽恕, 赦免, 免除, 缓和, 推迟, 汇出, 传送, 使复职

erase.中释: 抹去, 擦掉, 消磁, <俚>杀死
erase.英释: to remove information from a computer memory or recorded sounds from a tape

erupt.英释: if a volcano erupts, it explodes and sends smoke, fire, and rock into the sky

erode.中释: 侵蚀, 腐蚀, 使变化
erode.英释: if the weather erodes rock or soil, or if rock or soil erodes, its surface is gradually destroyed

flout.中释: 轻视, 嘲笑, 愚弄
flout.英释: If you flout something such as a law, an order, or an accepted way of behaving, you deliberately do not obey it or follow it

elide.中释: 取消, 省略, 省略发音, 不予考虑删节
elide.英释: to leave out the sound of a letter or of a part of a word

abate.中释: 使(数量、程度等)减少, 减轻, 除去, 缓和, 打折扣
abate.英释: to become less strong or decrease

embed.中释: 使插入, 使嵌入, 深留, 嵌入, [医]包埋
embed.英释: to put something firmly and deeply into something else, or to be put into something in this way

addle.英释: to confuse someone so they cannot think properly

besot.中释: 使烂醉, 使迷糊, 使沉醉

amass.中释: 收集, 积聚(尤指财富)
amass.英释: if you amass money, knowledge, information etc, you gradually collect a large amount of it

swill.中释: 涮, 冲洗, 痛饮, 倒出
swill.英释: to wash something by pouring a lot of water over it or into it

filch.中释: 偷窃(不贵重的东西), 窃取
filch.英释: to steal something small or not very valuable

impel.中释: 推动, 推进, 激励, 驱使, 逼迫
impel.英释: if something impels you to do something, it makes you feel very strongly that you must do it

emend.英释: to remove the mistakes from something that has been written

abhor.英释: to hate a kind of behaviour or way of thinking, especially because you think it is morally wrong

enact.中释: 制定法律, 颁布, 扮演
enact.英释: to act in a play, story etc

eject.中释: 逐出, 撵出, 驱逐, 喷射
eject.英释: to make someone leave a place or building by using force

bless.中释: 祝福, 保佑, <口>哎呀!我的天哪!
bless.英释: if God blesses someone or something, he helps and protects them

forgo.英释: to not do or have something pleasant or enjoyable
